page.title: 08THE SEA WALL
page.content: For centuries the flat area of the Wentloog levels has had a problem with flooding by rain or sea water.Early inhabitants made walls to prevent flooding from the sea,but the area was then flooded by rain.The romans dug ditches (reens) that let this water run down to the wall, where a gate opened at low tide to release the water.Sluice gates improved this system by letting out the rain water and preventing flooding from the sea.The present sea wall is an earth mound on a re-inforced base, backed by ditches to accommodate high water.It is well maintained by the Welsh Water Board.
